problems.title: Refrigerator light not working
troubleshooting_steps: Unplug the refrigerator from the power outlet for safety.
Open the refrigerator door and locate the light bulb cover (usually a small plastic or glass cover near the top).
Gently twist or remove the cover to access the bulb.
Check if the bulb is loose. If so, tighten it.
If the bulb appears burned out (darkened or broken filament), replace it with a compatible bulb.
Reinstall the cover and plug the refrigerator back in.
Test the light by opening and closing the door.

problems.title: Refrigerator not cooling properly
troubleshooting_steps: Check if the refrigerator is plugged in and the power is on.
Verify the temperature settings are correct (usually 37-40°F for fridge, 0°F for freezer).
Check if the door seals are clean and closing properly.
Ensure the refrigerator is not overloaded and air can circulate.
Check if the condenser coils (usually at the back or bottom) are dirty and need cleaning.

problems.title: Washing machine not spinning
troubleshooting_steps: Check if the load is unbalanced. Redistribute clothes evenly.
Ensure the machine is level on the floor.
Check if the lid/door is properly closed (some machines won't spin if open).
Verify the drain hose is not kinked or blocked.
Check for error codes on the display panel.

problems.title: Dishwasher not draining
troubleshooting_steps: Check if the drain hose is kinked or blocked.
Remove any large food particles from the bottom of the dishwasher.
Clean the filter (usually at the bottom) if accessible.
Check the garbage disposal connection (if connected) - ensure the knockout plug is removed.
Run a drain cycle to see if water clears.

problems.title: Oven not heating
troubleshooting_steps: Check if the oven is properly plugged in or the circuit breaker is on.
Verify the temperature setting is correct.
Check if the oven door is fully closed.
For gas ovens, ensure the gas supply is on and the pilot light is lit.
